title: Machine Learning Intern
description: Currently developing dynamic data miner for job postings across thousands of different websites. As well as a machine learning classifier for different types of job posts using natural language processing.

title: Student Instructor
description: Work with Berkeley students taking self-paced C++, Java and Python courses. Grade quizzes, tests and projects as well as give verbal assessments to find and cover any gaps in knowledge.

title: Teaching Intern
description: Worked with Professor Chapeton-Lamas to add software engineering paradigms to data structures and algorithms. Designed more involved group projects giving students a deeper understanding of linked lists and BSTs. The changes increased class retention rates by over 30%, integrated Trello, Slack, Github classroom and SCRUM.

title: Software Engineer Intern
description: Worked on QA, data mining, database integration and other tasks for startup travel site. Completed a project to make data mining twice as fast by moving selenium to cURL, also increasing the database size. Used BitBucket, Git, ROR, Ruby, Postgresql, Asana and Slack.

title: Computer Science Tutor
description: Tutor undergraduate students, helping with projects, homework and test review, had 1-10 undergraduate students daily. Worked with basic Java, advanced Java, Python and data structures and algorithms courses.
